intro: Codonanthe eggersii, commonly known as the Eggers' codonanthe, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
